item.title: CodeForces 1279D - Santa's Bot
item.description: 现在看来当时是真的菜，不过还是能学到一些奇怪的知识233 Solution There are at most $10^6$ pairs of $(x,y)$ so we can iterate over these pairs. Each pair has a probability of $\dfrac 1 {n\cdot k_x}$ being chosen so the probability of a valid triple is $\dfrac {cnt_y} {n\cdot k_x\cdot n}$, where $cnt_y$ is the number of kids who want gift $y$.
